result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Amended cash bond signed (re: travel restrictions)
Jury trial on April 26, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on March 30, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Cash bond posted 4/25/22.  Violation -  DC; Aggravated Battery; False Imprisonment; 1st Degree Reckless Injury; Intimidate Victim/Domestic Abuse Crime; Intimidate Victim/Threaten force, etc.  Issuing Agency - Green County
1. Defendant shall have no contact with L.M., except through counsel or a mutually agreed upon third party relating solely to child placement and custody matters.
2. Defendant shall have no contact with L.M.'s residence, except Defendant may access the premises where the residence is located to utilize the shed and associated open land for the purposes of his employment; the Defendant shall not come within 50 feet of the residence except solely for the purposes of ingress/egress from the shed. And as may be amended by Jo Daviess County, Illinois; may go back one time to collect personal property with law enforcement. 
3. Defendant shall not possess or consume intoxicants.
4. Defendant shall not travel outside the States of Illinois, Wisconsin, Minnesota, Iowa except for business purposes.
5. Defendant shall turn over his passport, if he possesses a passport, to the Green County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of release.

8:30 AM Defendant Stuart James Meighan in court.  Attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner in court for Stuart James Meighan.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin.
Matter not resolved - set 3 day JT #1.  12 person, 35 panel, 5 strikes, 1 Alt, notes OK.  MIL, proposed JI and verdict forms due 3/3/23.  Written responses due 3/17/23.  Motion hearing 3/30/23 10 a.m.  JT begins 4/26/23.  Cash bond modified as to travel restrictions.

Violation: DC, Aggravated Battery, False Imprisonment, 1st Degree Reckless Injury, Intimidate Victim/Domestic Abuse Crime, Intimidate Victim/Threaten force, ect.
Issuing Agency: Green County
1. Defendant shall have no contact with L.M., except through counsel or a mutually agreed upon third party relating solely to child placement and custody matters.
2. Defendant shall have no contact with L.M.'s residence, except Defendant may access the premises where the residence is located to utilize the shed and associated open land for the purposes of his employment; the Defendant shall not come within 50 feet of the residence except solely for the purposes of ingress/egress from the shed. And as may be amended by Jo Daviess County, Illinois; may go back one time to collect personal property with law enforcement. 
3. Defendant shall not possess or consume intoxicants.
4. Defendant shall not travel outside of Jo Daviess and Stephenson Counties, in the State of Illinois, Defendant shall not travel outside of Lafayette, Green, and Dane Counties, in the State of Wisconsin for personal travel. Defendant May Travel Nationwide for his trucking business purposes only.
5. Defendant shall turn over his passport, if he possesses a passport, to the Green County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of release.

2:48 PM Defendant Stuart James Meighan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner in court for Stuart James Meighan.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant of rights.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.  State requests a $200,000 cash bond. Attorney Van Wagner requests a signature bond. Attorney Van Wagner offers Exhibits #1 and #2 marked by the clerk. The court directs a $20,000 cash bond.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
